party.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a social event when a lot of people meet together to enjoy themselves by eating, drinking, dancing etc
party.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: We’re having a small party this evening to celebrate our wedding anniversary.
the party spirit (=the way someone feels when they are really enjoying a party)
The university threw a party to welcome them.
Are you going to the party tonight?
I met John at a party a couple of months ago.
party.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a political organization with particular beliefs and aims, which you can vote for in elections
party.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I have always voted for the Labour Party.
He failed to win the party’s nomination for president.
The conference is open to all party members.
party.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a group of people who go somewhere together or do a job together
party.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: There were several students in our party.
A search party was sent out to look for the missing climbers.
Admission is free for school parties.
party.translation[0].definitions[2].note: In meanings 2 and 3, party is usually followed by a singular verb
The party has accepted the need for change
The party  have accepted the need for change
party.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: one of the people or groups who are involved in a legal argument or agreement
party.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: helping the two parties to reach an agreement
He sees himself as the innocent party in this dispute.
party.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: a social event when a lot of people meet together to enjoy themselves by eating, drinking, dancing etc
party.translation[0].note_box[0].section: have a party
We’re having a party on Saturday night.
hold a party
The party was held at his flat.
throw/give a party
Staff threw a party to celebrate the news.
host a party
The party was hosted by the Danish ambassador.
go to/come to a party
Are you going to Tom’s party?
About 500 people will attend a party in her honour.
invite somebody to a party
I’ve been invited to Greg’s party next weekend.
gatecrash a party
Some older boys tried to gatecrash the party.
a party is in full swing
At 3 am, the party was still in full swing.
there is a party going on
Somewhere near the hotel there was a party going on.
a party breaks up
The party broke up a little after midnight.
ADJECTIVES/NOUN + party
a birthday party
They met at her sister’s 18th birthday party.
a Christmas/Halloween etc party
I hope you’re going to the office Christmas party.
a big/small party
I don’t really like going to big parties.
a dinner party
It’s a favorite topic of conversation at fashionable dinner parties these days.
a cocktail party
I first met him at a cocktail party at the American embassy.
a fancy dress party
She went to the fancy dress party as Snow White.
an office party
I danced with my boss at the office party.
a surprise party
Amy has planned a surprise party for his birthday.
a farewell/leaving party
You didn’t come to Ken’s farewell party, did you?
a street party
Thousands flocked to the street party on Princess Street to celebrate New Year.
a lavish party
He threw lavish parties for his celebrity friends.
party + NOUN
the party spirit
There’ll be plenty of free champagne to get the party spirit going.
be in a party mood
Kate wasn’t really in a party mood, so she stayed home.
party games
The children had great fun playing party games.
a party dress
The little girls were wearing white party dresses.
party.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 2: a political organization with particular beliefs and aims, which you can vote for in elections
party.translation[0].note_box[1].section: The Labour Party and the Conservative Party are the two main political parties in Britain.
The leadership race within the Republican Party is almost over.
The tax increase was criticized by opposition parties.
The ruling party’s level of support grew throughout the year.
Support for the right-wing parties was strongest among young working-class men.
He’s been a Conservative party member for 20 years.
He met with opposition party leaders.
The seat was won by the Socialist Party candidate with 68% of the vote.
His policies appeal to the party faithful.
Campaign literature is distributed by unpaid party activists.
There has been a change in party policy.
He will give a speech at the Tory party conference this morning.
He resigned as Conservative party chairman.
The incident has angered senior party officials.
Do you think the Labour Party can win the next election?
Bloomfield joined the Communist Party in 1946.
The two politicians broke away from the PDF to form a new political party.
From 1945 until 1951 the Labour Party was in power in Britain.
The ruling party came to power in May 2001.
party.translation[0].note_box[2].section: party
a social event when a lot of people meet together to enjoy themselves by eating, drinking, dancing etc
We’re having a party for Sarah’s 40th birthday.
I met my boyfriend at a party.
get-together
an informal party
Christmas is the perfect time for a family get-together.
a large formal party where people dance
the end of term ball
rave
a large party which is held outside or in an empty building, where people dance to music and take illegal drugs
reception
a large formal party, especially one after a wedding or to welcome an important person
The wedding reception is at a nearby hotel.
a reception for the Thai Foreign Minister
They attended a White House reception to mark the Queen’s visit.
function
a large formal or official party
He has been asked to play at many corporate functions (=an official party held by a company).
celebration
a party or special event that is organized in order to celebrate something
the country’s 50th anniversary celebrations
It was a 21st birthday celebration which Mary would never forget.
bash
a party, especially a big one that a lot of famous people go to – used especially in journalism
the star’s birthday bash
a picture of him at a Hollywood bash
a showbiz bash
do
a party
We’re having a do to celebrate Margaret’s birthday.
dinner party
a party where people are invited to someone’s house for an evening meal
I met him at a dinner party.
house-warming (party)
a party that you have when you move into a new house
We’re having a house-warming next week.
cocktail party
a party that people go to in order to talk and have a drink together for a few hours
fancy-dress party
a party where people dress in special clothes, for example to look like a famous person or a character in a story
hen party
a social event just before a wedding, for a woman who is getting married and her female friends
stag night
a social event just before a wedding, for a man who is getting married and his male friends
baby/wedding shower
an event at which people give presents to a woman who is going to have a baby or get married
party.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to enjoy yourself with a group of other people by drinking alcohol, eating, dancing etc
party.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: the people or group of people involved in a legal case, argument, agreement etc
party.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: It is difficult to obtain a ruling from the court if the other party contests  (=officially disagrees with) the decision.
copies of relevant correspondence between the parties
party.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: when two people are involved in a legal case, a third party is anyone who is not directly involved but might be affected by it
party.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: Touche Ross was criticised for not allowing third parties to see their report.
Switch from comprehensive tothird party insurance (=insurance covering anyone affected by an accident, as well as the person who takes out the insurance) if your car’s value has fallen.
party.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: an organization whose members share the same political beliefs and aims and which tries to get elected to government. The word ‘party’ is often used in the name of the organization
